name: Veg Pulao
ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, peas, potato)
Whole spices (1 bay leaf, 2 cardamoms, 2 cloves, 1 cinnamon stick)
instructions: Heat oil/ghee, sauté whole spices.
Add onion and green chili, cook until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, sauté for a minute.
Add chopped veggies, turmeric, garam masala, and salt. Sauté for 2-3 mins.
Add soaked rice and 2 cups water. Mix well.
Cover and cook on low until rice is done.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: Whole spices (1 bay leaf, 2 cloves, 2 cardamoms, 1 cinnamon stick)
instructions: Marinate chicken with curd, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 30 mins.
Cook rice 80% with salt and drain. Set aside.
In a pot, heat oil/ghee, add whole spices and sliced onions. Sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook till soft. Add marinated chicken, cook until tender and oil separates.
Add coriander and mint leaves.
Layer cooked rice over chicken, sprinkle some mint, coriander, and fried onions.
Cover and cook on low heat (dum) for 15-20 minutes.
Serve hot with raita or salan.

name: Ghee Dal Rice
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric and 2 cups water for 3-4 whistles until soft.
Mash the cooked dal and mix with salt.
In a small pan, heat ghee. Add cumin seeds, red chili, hing, and curry leaves for tempering.
Pour the tempering over the dal and mix well.
Serve the hot dal over rice with an extra spoon of ghee on top.

name: Veg Thali
ingredients: 1 small bowl vegetable curry (like aloo gobi or mixed veg)
instructions: Prepare rice and chapatis.
Cook dal with turmeric, salt and temper with mustard, cumin, and garlic.
Prepare a seasonal vegetable curry with spices.
Whisk curd and add spices or vegetables to make raita.
Serve all items together on a plate with a spoon of ghee on rice.
Add pickle or papad for sides.

name: Fish Fry
ingredients: 2 tbsp rice flour or semolina (for crispiness)
instructions: Clean fish slices thoroughly.
Mix chili powder, turmeric, salt, ginger garlic paste, and lemon juice to make a marinade.
Coat the fish slices in the marinade and let it rest for 20 minutes.
Sprinkle rice flour or semolina over both sides for a crispy texture.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the fish on medium heat until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with onion rings and lemon wedges.
